tutorial.title: Defining Grid Columns and Rows
tutorial.descriptionContent: Define grid columns and rows to through one this shorthand

lessons.title: Intro
lessons.interactiveContent: So far we've learned to create grid rows and columns separately. Let's now learn how to create both of them at the same time as shown below.

lessons.title: Grid template
lessons.interactiveContent:
We use the grid-template property to define grid rows and columns in one line.

Make sure to pick grid-template.

lessons.title: Grid template value
lessons.interactiveContent:
When using grid-template, the values on the left of the slash are rows and the ones on the right are columns. Code 50px 50px / 80px 80px.

Make sure to pick 50px followed by 50px and then /, 80px, 80px.

lessons.title: Mix of units I
lessons.interactiveContent:
If we want to, we can even mix different units together. Code 50px 50px / 1fr 1fr to only make the columns adjust to the containers size.

Make sure to pick 50px followed by 50px and then /, 1fr, 1fr.

lessons.title: Mix of units II
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can mix different relative units together for different results. For example, setting the rows to 60% auto and the columns to 1fr 1fr.

Make sure to pick 60% followed by auto and then /, 1fr, 1fr.

lessons.title: Rows and Columns
lessons.interactiveContent:
Although we're defining both rows and columns, we can still have more of one or the other.

Make sure to pick 1fr, followed by 1fr, and finally 1fr.

lessons.title: Question: Grid template
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does the grid-template property do?

Defines grid rows and columns all at the same timeDefines only grid rows at the same time

Defines grid rows and columns all at the same time.

lessons.title: Question: Grid template value
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which values set the grid rows in the following code?

50px 50px70px 70px

50px 50px.

lessons.title: Question: Mix of units I
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which measurements can we combine to create rows and columns that adapt in size?

1fr 1fr / 50% 50%50% 50% / 10px 1fr

1fr 1fr / 50% 50%.

lessons.title: Question: Mix of units II
lessons.interactiveContent:
What property and value should we use to create the following grid?

grid-template: 45px 60px 70px / 1fr 1frgrid-template: 1fr 1fr / 100px 50px

grid-template: 45px 60px 70px / 1fr 1fr.

lessons.title: Example: Grid template
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code grid-template property to set the grid rows and columns.

Make sure to type grid-template.

lessons.title: Example: Grid template value
lessons.interactiveContent:
Set grid rows values to 70px 70px and grid columns to 1fr 1fr.

Make sure to type 70px 70px / 1fr 1fr.

lessons.title: Example: Mix of units I
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create a grid where the rows have a fixed size and the first column is twice the size of the second column.

Make sure to pick 50px followed by 50px and then 2fr, 1fr.

lessons.title: Example: Mix of units II
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create a grid that has three columns that get progressively bigger.

Make sure to pick 20%, followed by 30%, and finally 50%.
